body.name: Diono Radian 3QX 4-in-1 Rear & Forward Facing Convertible Car Seat, Safe+ Engineering 3 Stage Infant Protection, 10 Years 1 Car Seat, Ultimate Protection, Slim Fit 3 Across, Black Jet
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 22 hrs 24 mins
features: NEXT GENERATION RADIAN ALL-IN-ONE CONVERTIBLE CAR SEAT - From infant to booster seat, rear and forward facing the Radian 3QX adapts as your child grows for 10 years of use (4 - 120 lb / 1.8 - 54 kg)

3-IN-1 REAR FACING PROTECTION - Designed for safe rear-facing travel from 4 - 50 lb (1.8 - 22.7 kg) complete with Safe plus inserts and Safe plus steel anti-rebound bar to reduce rebound rotation by 50 percent

SAFE plus ENGINEERING - Tested Radian all-in-one convertible car seat; featuring Safe+ steel rear-facing anti-rebound bar, steel reinforced frame, advanced side impact protection and Diono SuperLATCH attachment
ONE HAND EASY ADJUST 12 POSITION HEADREST - Contoured to improve child head containment and provides a 22 percent increase in occupancy range from the Radian R series

THE ORIGINAL RADIAN 3 ACROSS - Built with our famous Radian slim fit convertible design for a 3-across option only with Diono Radian combinations without compromising child or passenger comfort. Feel safe having your children secure in the backseat
body.description: The next generation diono Radian all-in-one convertible car seat that transforms as your child grows from baby to booster for 10 years one car seat (4 - 120 lb). Now upgraded with 20 improvements from the award-winning Radian 3RXT. Advanced 3-in-1 rear facing protection with SafePlus engineering to provide the next generation in convertible car seat safety. Radian 3QX provides baby and infant protection, with SafePlus newborn baby travel high wedge and 2-in-1 infant positioning liner for a custom fit from 4 lb. As your child grows the SafePlus steel rear facing anti-rebound bar increases stability and reduces rebound rotation by up to 50%, so you can keep them in a safe rear facing convertible car seat for longer up to 50 lb. As both a rear and forward facing convertible car seat the Radian 3QX protects as they grow, with the SafePlus easy adjust 12 position headrest that offers a 22% increase in occupancy range from the Radian R series. With 6 layers of side impact protection, SuperLATCH connectors (UAS Compatible) and safe 5-point harness, the Radian 3QX provides advanced safety from rear facing to forward facing harness booster to belt positioning booster modes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I like the quality and durability of this car seat. I’m using it for a toddler and they’re used to a big car seat like the maxi cosi or graco convertible ones so this was an adjustment in the seated positioning. As it is smaller and not as elevated. They fit well and it feels secure and easy to adjust to height.I got it to fit in my sante fe. It’s in the middle of two infant car seats on both sides. The convertible car seat was too big to fit with the infant car seats too. I plan to buy 2 more when my infants outgrow the buckets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This seat is VERY heavy. My son seems to be comfortable in it. It has many quality safety features. The fabric is a vibrant color, we got both the blue & purple. I would say I’m afraid to wash it as others have said it doesn’t fit properly after and I used just a wash clothe on it and can see that after just 4mo of use the fabric looks worn. The install was difficult & I’m really not sure if it’s exactly correct. We turned the seat forward facing for a better fit as our son is right at the mark for being forward facing. I have a video that won’t upload , YouTube has videos as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Our son and his wife say this is the best brand car seat. It's narrow enough to put 3 kids in the rear seat in car seats. That's the report from the users, not mine since we're too old to have kiddos but sure are enjoying the grandkids 🥰

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing car seat
reviews.reviewText: This is our third Diono car seat. We had 2 of the earlier models. YES, this car seat is heavy and that is why we bought it. We didn't want a car seat that rocked all over the car when we made a turn. It is very easy to install. I am 5'1 and it took me about 10 mins to put it in the car. This is definitely not a car seat to be traveling with UNLESS you're making a road trip. The cover is not that difficult to remove and put back on but if your scotch guard it and vacuum your car seat you won't have to do it that much (pro tip). My daughter loves her car seat so much.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Could be better/Britax comparison
reviews.reviewText: I bought This because I needed The thin profile to fit three across.(have a backless booster and Britax frontier in a smaller car) I bought A Britax blvd as well which is also a thin profile and has similar safety/steel enforced a few years ago for similar reasons. They both have pros and cons.Britax blvd click tight - so easy to install, no re thread harness. Adjustable recline. Cons: fabric isn’t as nice, higher profile. Cup holder is useless.Diono: pro: lower profile, anti rebound bar, nicer fabric. Cup holder is easierCons: cannot adjust recline, have to re thread to adjust harness, the head rest is awkward/bulky for smaller toddlers. The harness straps are bulky and my toddler easily takes them off to play with. Very hard to install. The legs for the RF plastic base hit my latch connectors. Could only install correctly in middle seat.Overall-I feel stuck with this because it’s a lower profile than the Britax and it works for my car. If I didnt Need every single last cm of space I wouldve went with the Britax. They are very similar in that they are not very wide but for my car the lower profile made a difference. For the price I wish They would add no rethread harness and an adjustable recline. My toddler doesn’t want to be laying back so far while RF.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My son loves this car seat and it is so comfortable. We had a long car ride of about 20 hours, and my 4 year old went the whole car ride snoring , and sitting comfortably . It’s a 10 ou of 10 for sure .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does not fit 3 across in a 2008 Forester
reviews.reviewText: The three across would probably fit well in a different car. But for me, in a 2008 Forester getting three car seats, 2 were to diono's and an infant car seat did not work. The diono's were too tall for where the support bar behind the rear door was located. They did not fit in a middle and side orientation as it pushed the infant seat at a weird angle that was not safe.So if you were looking for a suggestion for a 2008 Foreste: get one Diono, and two Graco slim fit lx. Those do fit in only two combinations, but they do fit. We love our Diono and that's why I had tried it as a 3 cross option originally.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fits 3 across in our 2013 Nissan Leaf!
reviews.reviewText: I’m so stoked we can get all 3 kids in our little car and I don’t have to use the gas guzzling van every time I need to drive with all 3 of them. Hallelujah!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente asiento y se siente muy seguro
reviews.reviewText: Un super asesino, que podrás usar con tu hijo mientras crece, y además permite instalar 3 en una fila de asientos.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best car seat on the market!
reviews.reviewText: THANK YOU Diono for Keeping my child Safe!!! After installing my NEW Diono 3QX I couldn’t believe the level of SAFETY and COMFORT my child gets to travel in. This seat really does provide OPTIMUM safety! The number of safety features listed in the handy manual is off the charts. For starters it has a full steal frame which makes it a little heavy but stresses the level of engineering and detail taken in making this unit. This seat has larger side walls with multiple layers of protective materials ensuring my child’s safety if ever in a side impact fender bender. This seat also has a memory foam cushion that my child gets to sit on while driving back and forth to Grandma’s house, my kid is traveling in luxury. All kidding aside this seat is loaded with soooo many options and features. The great thing about this seat is it will last me for at least 10 years! It has a longer life span then most seats in the market place and when in it's in a rear facing installation I can use it until she is 50lbs, it also converts to a forward facing positioned seat with a reinforced steal anti-rebound bar and when the time is right, it converts into a FULL BACK BOOSTER, which means I won't have to buy another seat, my child will just transition into it as she grows and grows. The adjustable headrest is very simple to use, it slides up and down 12 positions and it’s a breeze to adjust. Lastly the fabric feels comfortable, looks stylish and is easy to clean because the cover is removable and machine washable!!! AMAZING!!!!

Wow, aesthetically speaking this car seat if off the charts. My wife and I looked at several different brands over the last few months before transitioning our daughter to the next step. This convertible car seat doesn’t disappoint. Initially, we settled on the 3RXT. However, after committing to a little research, we found that the 3QX had additional safety features that we felt were essential to providing the best protection for our baby. The key features important to us were side-impact protection (6 layers…awesome) and keeping baby rear-facing as long as possible. Our previous infant car seat didn’t have an anti-rebound bar. We chose the 3QX over the 3RXT based on this additional feature. I now realize how important this option can be in preventing excess rebounding in a collision. Also, I assumed that all car seats were tested for roll overs. Again, thanks to my research I found out this was not the case. I’m glad Diono takes child safety seriously. It feels like there are doing a little more to protect my child. Finally, the steel frame was a deciding factor over the competition. Although I pray we won’t need it, I feel safer knowing we have a car seat made with steel frame protecting our child in a possible car crash.The other key features we considered a bonus were a memory foam cushion for seated comfort. Although we don’t have three children, it’s nice to know we could fit three across in our car when needed. Read between the lines honey. I much prefer the adjustable headrest on the 3QX over the 3RXT. We love to travel, therefore this car seat is ideal because it offers a foldable seat pan and is airline certified. Also, I found out that most airlines won't charge for car seats. It just makes to sense to use our own car seat vs. a rental seat. These are all great features that sold us on the Radian 3QX.
we have a clek and have bought this for our other child. Its narrow like clek which we love and to material is great. Protection is great as well

So far we like the seat as it’s narrow and super sturdy. We read the review and it had mentioned the set up takes an hour. So I let my partner handle it on his own so I didn’t intervene with my comments. We were mentally prepared to allow the time for set up. It has a lot of features since it convertible and because it’s heavy, it requires a lot of patience. It took him over an hour. We are happy with the seat and our daughter loves sitting forward. While we wanted to keep her facing backward, she is very tall and skinny at 16 months so rear facing mag not be good for her long legs. She barely met the min. require weight of 22lbs this week for us to set up the new seat. She is super comfortable in it and already had her first snooze in the seat.
